block.p: Jennifer Brooke Johnson, the daughter of Deborah Z. Johnson and Glen D. Johnson of Norman, Okla., was married yesterday to Anthony Joseph Hicks, a son of Maryann Hicks and Geoffrey K. Hicks of Haymarket, Va. The Rev. John B. Davis, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University in New York.

Mrs. Hicks, 27, is an assistant news editor at the online edition of The Wall Street Journal in New York. She graduated from the University of Oklahoma. She received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia, where she is an adjunct professor of new media. Her father is a broker for Sam B. Rose Oil and Gas Properties, an oil and gas leasing company in Norman. Her mother is the chief reader for Oklahoma Scoring Services, which scores standardized tests.

Jennifer Brooke Johnson, the daughter of Deborah Z. Johnson and Glen D. Johnson of Norman, Okla., was married yesterday to Anthony Joseph Hicks, a son of Maryann Hicks and Geoffrey K. Hicks of Haymarket, Va. The Rev. John B. Davis, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University in New York.

Mrs. Hicks, 27, is an assistant news editor at the online edition of The Wall Street Journal in New York. She graduated from the University of Oklahoma. She received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia, where she is an adjunct professor of new media. Her father is a broker for Sam B. Rose Oil and Gas Properties, an oil and gas leasing company in Norman. Her mother is the chief reader for Oklahoma Scoring Services, which scores standardized tests.

Mr. Hicks, 28, is the manager of wholesale operations at Global Rock Networks, a telecommunications concern in New York; he sells telephone connection services to phone companies. He graduated from the University of Virginia. His father is the vice president for operations at BroadSoft, a maker of telephone software in Gaithersburg, Md.
